subject: "Leading Inclusively" for an EMEA audience on 10 March?
body:
Hello, Almendra,  
How are you today? I know you’ve worked with others at LCW and I’ve heard great things about you!
I wanted to see if by chance you might be up to facilitating a “Leading Inclusively” workshop for one of our clients (a global medical devices company) for an EMEA (mostly European) audience on March 10
th
 from 11am to 2pm CET (with a 10 min break). We have already designed the content and facilitator notes.
Here’s the bad news - our budget is quite small at this time due to current strains to our industry, as I’m sure you’re well aware…. So we can’t pay our usual rates at this time. We cannot afford to pay more than $300 per hour of facilitation, so the total would be $300*3 = $900, including prep.
 
What do you think? 
Warmly,
Rebecca
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
 
(MBA, Latina, LGBTQ, Mom)
(she/her) 
Why pronouns matter
Head of Client Solutions
We help develop the mindsets and systems needed to foster resilient, diverse, and equitable teams that will be successful in a cross-cultural world.
Website
 
|
 
Facebook
 
|
 
LinkedIn
 
I live and work in Chapel Hill, NC – on the traditional homelands of the Occaneechi, Shakori, Eno, and Sissipahaw peoples.

Hi Britelings, Thank you in advance for taking part in our focus group which will help Eventbrite design strategies to improve belonging.This is an opportunity to dive deeper into opportunities to ens
  
 
This event has been updated
Changed:
 description
 
  
 
Description
CHANGED
Hi Britelings, 
Thank you in advance for taking part in our focus group which will help Eventbrite design strategies to improve belonging.This is an opportunity to dive deeper into opportunities to ensure our organization is diverse, inclusive, and equitable for you and your teams.
It is critical to the DEI team that all individuals who join the focus groups participate in a way that makes them feel comfortable and safe to share their insights. Please know we have a strong commitment to maintaining confidentiality at the utmost level. We will NOT share any names or identifying information, but we will share the insights you provide. In addition, we willNOT be recording the sessions.
All focus groups are 1-hour in length and will be conducted virtually via Zoom.
Your focus group will be conducted on November 29th at 5:30 am PT.
We have partnered with LCW, a global training and consulting firm focused on intercultural competence, DEI, and debiasing talent processes, to lead the focus groups. 
We look forward to your participation and thank you again for partaking in our focus group. Should you have any questions at all, please reach out to me directly.
Thank you on behalf of Eventbrite and LCW.
If you have any questions at all please don't hesitate to reach out to Bridget Cincotta.
When
Wednesday Nov 29, 2023 
⋅

Where:
 
https://languageandculture.zoom.us/j/84335505281
 
Zoom meeting link: 
https://languageandculture.zoom.us/j/84335505281
 
Dear Team,
 
Last month, I shared our excitement 
to continue our journey to deliver on our 
commitment and planned strategic actions to kick off a holistic approach to Strengthen Leadership Capabilities and continue to Build Inclusive Leadership skills.   
 
We are strategically investing time and resources to build these skills and capabilities. We
 
heard from you (
Our Voice/Credo Surveys
) that we have an opportunity to strengthen leadership capabilities and continue to equip everyone to foster a
 
culture of inclusion and support an environment
 
where each of you are considered a unique individual. 
 
In the spirit of learning together, you will receive a calendar invitation from me with the preferred options for our team to dedicate the time and space to engage in these conversations.  This session will be focused on 
The Power of Allyship
. 
We will offer 3 sessions to fit various global time zones, 
please plan to attend 1 of the 3 that are offered
. 
The Zoom link is enclosed in the “location” section of the meeting hold
.   Please note, these sessions 
will not
 be recorded due to the sensitive/proprietary nature of the contents. 
 
Thank you for your continued engagement and 
I encourage you to invest in your development and attend one these sessions
.  
 
Best,
Chris

Hello everyone, 
 
Let’s get together to go through Day 1 and Day 2 of the DEI Forum for Europe. 
Should we need additional time I can set up another call, but since we are having separate briefing calls with the panelists and Diana for her regional remarks, we might get it done in 2 hrs.
 
@Daniel Gough
: It would be great if you can forward this invitation to the respective LCW trainers for the European sessions. Thank you.
 
Looking forward to talking to you.
Best regards, 
Lisa

Understanding Microaggressions
. 
We will offer 3 sessions to fit various global time zones, 
please plan to attend 1 of the 3 that are offered
. The Zoom link is enclosed in the “location” section of the meeting hold.  Please note, these sessions 
will 
not be recorded due to the sensitive/proprietary nature of the contents.
 
Thank you for your continued engagement and 
I encourage you to invest in your development and attend these sessions
.  
 
Best,
Chris

subject: RE: new client/project - June 20 availability
body:
Hi Almendra,
 
It’s great to hear from you, and I hope you have been well!
 
I’m sorry to say that Grace is no longer with LCW. However, I have taken over duties for this client, and I will definitely reach out to you in the future should we need someone outside of our in-house staff to facilitate for this. Right now, though, things are pretty quiet, so I don’t think I need to take up your time with a meeting to discuss them (just yet 
😊
).
 
All the best,
Vince 
 
Vince Bongiovanni
(he/him)
Associate Consultant

> escribió:
﻿ 
Hello Almendra, thank you so much for your reply and enthusiasm! My apologies for a slow return on my side, it’s been a very busy week…
For right now it turns out that we will not need support on June 20, but we expect a good amount of these trainings with this client, so I’d still love to find time, bring you up to speed on the client, and get in a good place for when their requests start coming in. This coming week and a half is exceptionally busy for us as we head to Chicago for our retreat. Could you meet on June 1
st
 or 2
nd
 to talk through the project?
 
Talk to you soon!
 
Best,
Grace

Dear Grace,
Thank you so much for thinking of me! Yes, I am interested and available at that time. For me it will be 9:00 to 10:30 pm in Madrid, and as you know dinner will be afterwards, so all OK!
I'm just cc'ing myself at my company address so that I am sure not to miss your messages as I don't usually have this email open. I'm happy I did have a look!
When would be a good time to talk about the project?
All the best, un abrazo,
Almendra
From:
 Grace Vottero <
g.vottero@lcwmail.com
>
Sent:
 Thursday, May 11, 2023 21:24
To:
 Almendra Staffa-Healey <
a.staffahealey@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Vince Bongiovanni <
v.bongiovanni@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 new client/project - June 20 availability
 
 
Hello Almendra,
 
It was so lovely to facilitate with you the other month! I was hoping to have an opportunity to work together again, and a new client need has come up. I am reaching out to see if you are both available and interested in supporting a few deliveries of our Understanding Microaggressions training. The courses will be delivered in English, but our client (the Inter-American Development Bank) is eager for a facilitator that can receive and answer questions in Spanish. I also think it will make the training even more effective.
 
Are you interested? And if you are, might you be available for an initial training on June 20 from 3-4:30 PM EST? 
 
I’d love to set up a quick time to chat through the project if you’re interested and able (even if you can’t make that specific time work) – let me know what you think!
 
Thanks,
Grace
 
------------------------------------------------------
Grace Vottero
(she/her/hers)
Consultant,
 LCW

g.vottero@lcwmail.com

 Vince Bongiovanni <
v.bongiovanni@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 new client/project - June 20 availability
 
 
Hello Almendra,
 
It was so lovely to facilitate with you the other month! I was hoping to have an opportunity to work together again, and a new client need has come up. I am reaching out to see if you are both available and interested in supporting a few deliveries of our Understanding Microaggressions training. The courses will be delivered in English, but our client (the Inter-American Development Bank) is eager for a facilitator that can receive and answer questions in Spanish. I also think it will make the training even more effective.
 
Are you interested? And if you are, might you be available for an initial training on June 20 from 3-4:30 PM EST? 
 
I’d love to set up a quick time to chat through the project if you’re interested and able (even if you can’t make that specific time work) – let me know what you think!
 
Thanks,
Grace
 
------------------------------------------------------
Grace Vottero

subject: RE: new client/project - June 20 availability
body:
Hello Almendra, thank you so much for your reply and enthusiasm! My apologies for a slow return on my side, it’s been a very busy week…
For right now it turns out that we will not need support on June 20, but we expect a good amount of these trainings with this client, so I’d still love to find time, bring you up to speed on the client, and get in a good place for when their requests start coming in. This coming week and a half is exceptionally busy for us as we head to Chicago for our retreat. Could you meet on June 1
st
 or 2
nd
 to talk through the project?
 
Talk to you soon!
 
Best,
Grace

subject: RE: Advancing Inclusion - Mid-point Check-in
body:
Hi Almendra and Anais, 
 
I will not be able to attend this session as I have already multiple meetings booked during that time. Apologies for that. 
 
Best regards, 
Desiree Tan 
 
Truly Human Notice: Getting this email outside of working hours? We work in a digitally-enabled relentless pace, which can disrupt our ability to sleep enough, eat right, exercise or spend time with people who matter most. subject: Cambios en las Condiciones de servicio y la Política de privacidad
body:
Hola, Almendra:
Buscamos constantemente maneras de mejorar la experiencia de Dropbox y ampliar nuestras ofertas de funciones. En los últimos años, hemos dado la bienvenida a HelloSign, ahora Dropbox Sign, y a DocSend a la familia de Dropbox, y ahora ofreceremos estos servicios como parte integrada de Dropbox. Si aún no has utilizado estos servicios, ahora podrás acceder a ellos desde tu cuenta de Dropbox. Estamos realizando algunas actualizaciones en nuestras Condiciones del servicio y Política de privacidad para reflejar estos y algunos otros cambios:
Condiciones del servicio
•
Hemos añadido información sobre el uso de los servicios Dropbox Sign y DocSend.
•
También hemos incorporado aclaraciones sobre cuáles son tus responsabilidades en caso de que decidas habilitar integraciones de terceros con Dropbox.
•
Ahora nos referimos a los equipos de Dropbox Business como "equipos de Dropbox" y hemos actualizado las Condiciones del servicio en consecuencia.
Política de privacidad
•
Hemos añadido información para explicar cómo funciona la recopilación de datos si utilizas DocSend, las estadísticas de visualización del contenido de Dropbox o nuestros servicios de firma electrónica.
•
También hemos aclarado cómo utilizamos tus datos cuando interactúas con los representantes de Dropbox en determinados contextos de marketing.
•
Ahora nos referimos a los equipos de Dropbox Business como "equipos de Dropbox" y hemos actualizado la Política de privacidad en consecuencia.
Echa un vistazo a las 
Condiciones del servicio
 y a la 
Política de privacidad
 completas. Entrarán en vigor el 3 de abril de 2023. Si continúas usando Dropbox después de esa fecha, significará que aceptas las nuevas condiciones. Puedes consultar nuestras condiciones previas 
aquí
. Para obtener más información, visita nuestro 
Centro de ayuda
.
¡Gracias!
- El equipo de Dropbox

subject: LCW Exec Relocation
body:
Hello Almendra,
 
I hope you are doing well, I’m looking forward to connecting with you next week to update on the NBCU Part 2 content for the Theatrical Dubbing teams. I’ll forward you the deck today. It runs similarly to Conscious Inclusion so I think it shouldn’t be too unfamiliar.
 
I’m writing today because we have a client who has a new CEO coming in from Italy to the US; and while he has worked globally, this will be his first time living and working in the US and leading a US team that has a strong DEI commitment. The goal is to have a 4-hour session with an IDI to be delivered before February 27
th
.
 
If you are interested, could you please send me availability that we could offer the client where you can dedicate 4 hours. We could compensate you at a rate of $2,000.
 
Please let me know if this is something you’d like to take on and your availability.
 
Tamara
 
 
-
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Tamara Thorpe (she/her)
Principal Consultant, LCW
Email: t.thorpe@lcwmail.com
Phone: +1-773-888-4942
 
 
   
www

foster equity in the communities where people
live and at the organizations where they work.

body:

 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
Hola, Almendra:
Te escribimos para informarte de que tienes disponible una versión actualizada de Dropbox para macOS. Esta versión actualizada de la aplicación de Dropbox ofrece una integración completa con macOS para garantizar que disfrutes de la mejor experiencia de Dropbox.
Para empezar, asegúrate de que tu ordenador tenga la última versión de macOS y haz clic en el icono de Dropbox en la barra de menús. En la notificación que aparecerá, haz clic en 
Comenzar

From:

Subject:
 RE: Timeline for cohort 2
 
 
Hello Almendra, 
Hope you are well - answers to your questions below:
For this 2
nd
 cohort, I have a teams' conversation for now. I will activate the teams group later on. 
For this 2
nd
 HR cohort, mid point check in should be mid January 
Closing in May 
I am trying to go back to a rhythm of monthly lessons, Max every 5 weeks. 
I'll be there on the call this morning to do a short intro. Would it be possible to record the meeting as well? 
Thank you 
Raphaëlle

 Thursday, September 29, 2022 20:40
To:
 Almendra Staffa-Healey <a.staffahealey@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Raphaëlle Lalo <raphaelle.lalo@ubisoft.com>; Jeffrey Cookson <j.cookson@lcwmail.com>; Tamara Thorpe <t.thorpe@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: Feedback regarding the Ubisoft check in
 
 
Hello Almendra,
 
Thank you so much for these reflections. We are working on ideating how we want to move forward now that we have gotten to do both debriefs so we can set up participants for success.
 
I’ll let me know if we have further questions, but this assessment is great for now.
 
Thanks again,
 
 
Ada Vargas | they/them
Associate Consultant
LCW

From:
 Almendra Staffa-Healey <a.staffahealey@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Thursday, September 29, 2022 10:25 AM
To:
 Ada Vargas <a.vargas@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Raphaëlle Lalo <raphaelle.lalo@ubisoft.com>; Jeffrey Cookson <j.cookson@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Feedback regarding the Ubisoft check in
 
Dear Ada,
I just wanted to get you some of my notes and reflections regarding my Ubisoft check in. I'm cc'ing in Raphaëlle, and am also sharing with Jeffrey, so that he can have the information too.
 
Raphaëlle and I met briefly before the start, and she gave me some information regarding the mood of the group. She mentioned that this has been a fairly hectic time for them, especially in HR as there has been a lot of pressure on their side. We decided to ask permission to record the session so she could view it later as she wasn't going to be able to attend.  We also agreed that I would share that I knew that things were hectic because Raphaëlle and I had spoken. 
 
There were 4 participants for the first 1/2 hour and then we were joined by a 5th. They agreed that it was OK to record. They also indicated that they hadn't started lesson 3 yet as they've had it for 2 days. The general mood was collaborative, open and reflective.
 
Earlier this morning I shared the recording with Raphaëlle.
 
My key take-aways from the meta conversation on the learning program were:
a greater need for constraint in terms of timing and an increase in remainders. Because of the stress of the HR job, to ensure better support for the autonomous work so that it gets done
lesson 1 had a much larger scope of work than lesson 2, also some readings were very long. The level of challenge on lesson one was greater too than lesson 2
the pair work was very valuable, when followed. Sarah Hinchcliffe-Smith mentioned that she doesn't have a partner and is looking forward to getting one
the content and reflection were very eye-opening, they appreciate the challenge of the work
enjoyment over the IDI debriefs and learning about own levels of competency and areas for growth and development
testimonials are very helpful and bring to life the experiences of the cultures represented
I actually started with a discussion on lesson 2 first and then we went to lesson 1 as lesson 2 was more present for them. 
 
In addition to this, during the discussion, Antonine Bocage-Marchand indicated that he doesn't see the DEI strategy, perhaps it is being discussed higher up with regards to policies regarding disabilities and race/ethnicity, however the only place he recognizes it being addressed is in relation to ERGs. 
 
It seemed as if others were more aware of the strategy; a little hard to tell though. My recommendation is to check in with HR managers to make sure that they are aware of the strategy, provided that there have been decisions made that will help them to better carry out their roles. 
 
If any of you have questions about this or would like further details, do please let me know.
 
All the best, and I hope today's afternoon check in goes well!
-Almendra

I’ll let me know if we have further questions, but this assessment is great for now.
 
Thanks again,
 
 
Ada Vargas | they/them
Associate Consultant
LCW 
 
 
   
www

From:
 Almendra Staffa-Healey <a.staffahealey@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Thursday, September 29, 2022 10:25 AM
To:
 Ada Vargas <a.vargas@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Raphaëlle Lalo <raphaelle.lalo@ubisoft.com>; Jeffrey Cookson <j.cookson@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Feedback regarding the Ubisoft check in
 
Dear Ada,
I just wanted to get you some of my notes and reflections regarding my Ubisoft check in. I'm cc'ing in Raphaëlle, and am also sharing with Jeffrey, so that he can have the information too.
 
Raphaëlle and I met briefly before the start, and she gave me some information regarding the mood of the group. She mentioned that this has been a fairly hectic time for them, especially in HR as there has been a lot of pressure on their side. We decided to ask permission to record the session so she could view it later as she wasn't going to be able to attend.  We also agreed that I would share that I knew that things were hectic because Raphaëlle and I had spoken. 
 
There were 4 participants for the first 1/2 hour and then we were joined by a 5th. They agreed that it was OK to record. They also indicated that they hadn't started lesson 3 yet as they've had it for 2 days. The general mood was collaborative, open and reflective.
 
Earlier this morning I shared the recording with Raphaëlle.
 
My key take-aways from the meta conversation on the learning program were:
a greater need for constraint in terms of timing and an increase in remainders. Because of the stress of the HR job, to ensure better support for the autonomous work so that it gets done
lesson 1 had a much larger scope of work than lesson 2, also some readings were very long. The level of challenge on lesson one was greater too than lesson 2
the pair work was very valuable, when followed. Sarah Hinchcliffe-Smith mentioned that she doesn't have a partner and is looking forward to getting one
the content and reflection were very eye-opening, they appreciate the challenge of the work
enjoyment over the IDI debriefs and learning about own levels of competency and areas for growth and development
testimonials are very helpful and bring to life the experiences of the cultures represented
I actually started with a discussion on lesson 2 first and then we went to lesson 1 as lesson 2 was more present for them. 
 
In addition to this, during the discussion, Antonine Bocage-Marchand indicated that he doesn't see the DEI strategy, perhaps it is being discussed higher up with regards to policies regarding disabilities and race/ethnicity, however the only place he recognizes it being addressed is in relation to ERGs. 
 
It seemed as if others were more aware of the strategy; a little hard to tell though. My recommendation is to check in with HR managers to make sure that they are aware of the strategy, provided that there have been decisions made that will help them to better carry out their roles. 
 
If any of you have questions about this or would like further details, do please let me know.
 
All the best, and I hope today's afternoon check in goes well!
-Almendra

subject: TR: Advancing Inclusion // CrossCultural Mentoring // Mid Checkin(Option 1)
body:
-----Rendez-vous d'origine-----
De :
 Raphaëlle Lalo 
Envoyé :
 vendredi 4 mars 2022 09:51
À :
 Raphaëlle Lalo; Maëlle Blandin; Antoine Bocage-Marchand; Gregory Cecchin; Margaret Cervo; Anne Charron; Audrey Chatelet; Caroline Deforge; Catherine Descheneaux; Marion Dufour; Stefanie Egbers; Amélie Lapointe; Kara Henander; Sarah Hinchcliffe-Smith; Ji Yi Jin; Catherine Lafontaine; Anca-Elena Lazaroiu; Mari Liesjärvi; Belinda Martinez; Pierre Mazeaud; Travis McGill; Emilie Ovaert; Gwendoline Pettenuzzo; Courtney Riss (O'Neil); Magdalena Schultze; Ashley Smith; Kaushiki Srivastava; Karl Teasdale; Matthew Wiazowski; Kévin Bouchareb; Nawale Bouzeboudja; Erin Roach; Michael Streffery
Cc :
 Raashi Sikka; Ada Vargas; 
j.cookson@lcwmail.com
Objet :
 Advancing Inclusion // CrossCultural Mentoring // Mid Checkin(Option 1) 
Date :
 jeudi 29 septembre 2022 18:00-19:00 (UTC+01:00) Bruxelles, Copenhague, Madrid, Paris.
Où :
 Upcoming Link
 
[N. America and Europe time]
 
What you can expect from this “Advancing Inclusion” learning journey: 
 
An invitation to complete a 
20mn-long online, individual survey
 – 
your ‘IDI Profile’
, powered by 
IDI, LLC
. This tool is called the Intercultural Development Inventory
®
 
and it assesses intercultural competence—the capability to shift cultural perspective and appropriately adapt behavior to cultural differences and commonalities. Once you have completed your profile, you can expect a 30mn individual debrief by our partner, 
LCW
. Your profile and information will be confidential and shared only with LCW and the project team. 
 
Outlook invitation to attend 2x2h hours of 
facilitated trainings
, for each of the 3 groups 
 
Starting April and based on your IDI profile, 
you will be paired with another HR colleague
 who is culturally different from you in some significant way (e.g. based on gender, native language, level of education, seniority, job function, nationality etc.)
With this partner, you will work together in a process of “reciprocal mentoring” on monthly case studies, inspired by real anecdotes or workplace issues
Between April & July/September, there will be 3x1h sessions to support you and your partner through group discussions
Last but not least, we will be creating a Teams channel starting April to facilitate and support you through this ‘reciprocal mentoring” process.

to: almendra@interculturalunderstanding.eu, a.staffahealey@lcwmail.com, maelle.blandin@ubisoft.com, antoine.bocage-marchand@ubisoft.com, gregory.cecchin@ubisoft.com, margaret.cervo@ubisoft.com, anne.charron@ubisoft.com, audrey.chatelet@ubisoft.com, caroline.deforge@ubisoft.com, catherine.descheneaux@ubisoft.com, marion.dufour3@ubisoft.com, stefanie.egbers@ubisoft.com, amelie.lapointe@ubisoft.com, kara.henander@ubisoft.com, sarah.hinchcliffe-smith@ubisoft.com, yi-jin.ji@ubisoft.com, catherine.lafontaine@ubisoft.com, anca-elena.lazaroiu@ubisoft.com, mari.liesjarvi@ubisoft.com, belinda.martinez@ubisoft.com, pierre.mazeaud@ubisoft.com, travis.mcgill@ubisoft.com, emilie.ovaert@ubisoft.com, gwendoline.pettenuzzo@ubisoft.com, courtney.riss@ubisoft.com, magdalena.schultze@massive.se, ashley.smith@ubisoft.com, kaushiki.srivastava@ubisoft.com, karl.teasdale@ubisoft.com, matthew.wiazowski@ubisoft.com, kevin.bouchareb@ubisoft.com, nawale.bouzeboudja@ubisoft.com, erin.roach@ubisoft.com, michael.streffery@ubisoft.com

¡Hola!
Aquí empiezan tus primeros pasos
Estamos aquí para ayudarte a ponerlo todo en marcha. No importa si quieres hacer una copia de seguridad de tus dispositivos o compartir fotos y vídeos con amigos y compañeros de trabajo, vamos a enseñarte lo fácil que es hacerlo con Dropbox.
Comenzar
→
Sube contenido y compártelo al momento
Lo primero es lo primero. Y llega el momento de añadir tu primer archivo a tu recién estrenada cuenta de Dropbox. Pronto podrás ahorrar espacio de almacenamiento, compartir fotos con amigos y familiares y colaborar con compañeros de trabajo en documentos importantes.
Sube y comparte contenido

Guárdalas y compártelas de forma segura
Cuando guardas tus fotos de familia en la nube, puedes compartirlas fácilmente con tus seres queridos sin tener que preocuparte de perderlas. Descubre cómo subir, organizar y compartir tus mejores recuerdos en Dropbox.

subject: Stay connected and organized with Outlook mobile

Get Outlook for iOS and Android | Access your email, calendar and contacts from a single app | You are receiving this training email so you can get the most out of the Microsoft products you already use, like Outlook. The Outlook mobile app lets you manage your emails, appointments, contacts, and documents in a single place without the need to open multiple apps.
Get Outlook for iOS and Android | 
View in browser

You are receiving this training email so you can get the most out of the Microsoft products you already use, like Outlook. The Outlook mobile app lets you manage your emails, appointments, contacts, and documents in a single place without the need to open multiple apps. 
 
Download Outlook mobile
 
 
10 tips to learn the basics
Learn how to switch accounts, navigate your calendar, set an automatic reply, and more helpful tips. 
Watch the video

subject: Prudential IDI Debrief Opportunity
body:
Hello wonderful IDI Partners,
 
I am writing to ask for your help in delivering individual IDI debriefs to senior leaders at Prudential as part of an ongoing multifaceted DEI program. You would be involved in one facet of the program – individual IDI coaching sessions for leaders.
 
The program we need your help with is called Building Cultural Intelligence – it’s basically a Prudential-specific version of our Building a Culture of Inclusion, which you may be familiar with. We are delivering the program systematically to intact leadership teams across the organization – teams that lead business lines, functions, or geographies. The session includes an IDI group debrief, so leaders are taking the IDI as prework. Afterwards (and where we hope you will come in), each participant will receive a 30-minute Individual Debrief session. Everyone at Prudential (sponsors and participants) are really excited to be going through this journey with us, as we have expanded on the offerings we did last year, and they have all heard wonderful things.
 
THE ASK: We have another 18 Groups who will be going through this process with us this Calendar year. Each group could be as large as 50 people, so we would love to have you as our primary IDI Facilitators for this journey. If you are interested in this, we ask that you commit to performing at least 
100 of these 30-minute IDI Debriefs by the end of the year, depending on scheduling, to which you would receive $60/30-minute debrief.
  PLEASE NOTE: We realize this price may be below what we are paying you for other engagements, and are hoping that the potential for high volume will help offset that – unfortunately this client negotiated with strongarm tactics and is paying us very little – we are just trying to break even and give them a good experience. 
 
The first group that we will need to be scheduling for goes through their Group Debrief on September 8, and have group debriefs almost every week (sometimes twice a week) until the last one on December 8. Ideally, we will have at least a few available times every weekday for participants to choose from, based on your availability, starting on September 9
th
, and going through December 30
th
 (obviously with some holidays and days off excluded).
 
If this is something you are interested in working with us on, please, let me know and I will send over the required documentation as well as begin working with you to accumulate times.
 
Please, let me know if you have any questions or concerns.
 
Thank you,
 
Conner Williams, CPCC
Consultant
LCW 
100 S Saunders Rd, Suite 150
Lake Forest, IL 60045 USA
Gender pronouns: He/Him/His

subject: FleishmanHillard Focus Group - EMEA
body:
Hi all - Please use the following Zoom link for the session tomorrow: 
https://languageandculture.zoom.us/j/89475161668?pwd=YVMwdE1iOTNsMXh1Qmg1VE95VVA1dz09
 
 
You have been selected to participate in an important diversity, equity and inclusion (DE&I) initiative within FleishmanHillard. We’ve partnered with a global DE&I consultancy called
 
LCW
 
to conduct a bias and inclusion audit of FleishmanHillard. As part of this, they are hosting a series of focus groups with several communities across the firm. You’ve been selected to participate in the EMEA focus group.
 
To participate we will need one hour of your time on
 
Wednesday, July 6 at 2pm CEST // SAST
 
[
1pm BST // IST].
 
We know many of you were told about this initiative a few months ago, and after a delay, we’re excited to be moving forward and appreciate your patience as we’ve finalized the details.
 
 
The audit is a key step on our journey to becoming the most inclusive communications agency in the world. As part of the process, LCW is completing an in-depth analysis of organizational mindsets as well as people policies and systems at FleishmanHillard to assess our culture and identify potential biases.  
 
We understand that we completed the global DE&I and employee engagement surveys earlier in the year, both of which provide critical feedback about the employee experience at FleishmanHillard. With this process we’re looking to better understand
 
how
 
our people systems and processes can drive a more inclusive culture and address barriers to progress. The focus groups specifically will create a safe space for you to have an interactive dialogue with a third party, allowing us to gain
 
different, deeper and more comprehensive
 
insights that typically aren’t possible with surveys. All of these initiatives are imperative as we look to drive meaningful impact for our firm and our people.   
 
During the focus group, LCW will lead a discussion around how our firm can better prioritize the topics and issues that are important to you. Your feedback will help inform a strategic roadmap outlining how FleishmanHillard can advance inclusion throughout the firm, including enhancements to future learning and development. Attached to the invite is a background document with some additional information about LCW and the audit, as well as a short Q&A. You will also find a bio for the LCW consultant who is facilitating the session.  
 
Our employees are the most critical part of our culture. You were recommended for this focus group by your leadership, and we highly encourage you to participate in this important initiative. If you are unable to join, or have additional questions, please reach out to 
@Rachel Coleman (FleishmanHillard)
 soon as possible.
 
Achieving progress is part of everyone’s job at FleishmanHillard, and we are excited to move forward on this next step of our journey.  
 
As always, thank you for your continued support with helping us become the most inclusive agency in the world.
For information about how we process personal data, please visit our privacy policy at https://fleishmanhillard.com/privacy-policy-general/ and our privacy policy applicable to the European Economic Area at https://fleishmanhillard.com/gdpr-privacy-policy/.

subject: RE: PA for FleishmanHillard Focus Group Facilitation

subject: HOLD: FleishmanHillard Focus Group - EMEA
body:
You have been selected to participate in an important diversity, equity and inclusion (DE&I) initiative within FleishmanHillard. We’ve partnered with a global DE&I consultancy called
 
LCW
 
to conduct a bias and inclusion audit of FleishmanHillard. As part of this, they are hosting a series of focus groups with several communities across the firm. You’ve been selected to participate in the EMEA focus group.
 
To participate we will need one hour of your time on
 
Wednesday, July 6 at 2pm CEST // SAST
 
[
1pm BST // IST].
 
We know many of you were told about this initiative a few months ago, and after a delay, we’re excited to be moving forward and appreciate your patience as we’ve finalized the details.
 
 
The audit is a key step on our journey to becoming the most inclusive communications agency in the world. As part of the process, LCW is completing an in-depth analysis of organizational mindsets as well as people policies and systems at FleishmanHillard to assess our culture and identify potential biases.  
 
We understand that we completed the global DE&I and employee engagement surveys earlier in the year, both of which provide critical feedback about the employee experience at FleishmanHillard. With this process we’re looking to better understand
 
how
 
our people systems and processes can drive a more inclusive culture and address barriers to progress. The focus groups specifically will create a safe space for you to have an interactive dialogue with a third party, allowing us to gain
 
different, deeper and more comprehensive
 
insights that typically aren’t possible with surveys. All of these initiatives are imperative as we look to drive meaningful impact for our firm and our people.   
 
During the focus group, LCW will lead a discussion around how our firm can better prioritize the topics and issues that are important to you. Your feedback will help inform a strategic roadmap outlining how FleishmanHillard can advance inclusion throughout the firm, including enhancements to future learning and development. Attached to the invite is a background document with some additional information about LCW and the audit, as well as a short Q&A. You will also find a bio for the LCW consultant who is facilitating the session.  
 
Our employees are the most critical part of our culture. You were recommended for this focus group by your leadership, and we highly encourage you to participate in this important initiative. If you are unable to join, or have additional questions, please reach out to 
@Rachel Coleman (FleishmanHillard)
 soon as possible.
 
Achieving progress is part of everyone’s job at FleishmanHillard, and we are excited to move forward on this next step of our journey.  
 
As always, thank you for your continued support with helping us become the most inclusive agency in the world.
For information about how we process personal data, please visit our privacy policy at https://fleishmanhillard.com/privacy-policy-general/ and our privacy policy applicable to the European Economic Area at https://fleishmanhillard.com/gdpr-privacy-policy/.

Subject:
 RE: UPI/LCW Workshop #1 Powerpoint
 
 
Hello everyone!
 
Thanks so much for your leadership; we are looking forward to Part 2. We have a better sense of the audience and their readiness for the conversation and sticking points that we will use to build Part 2. We will definitely begin with the content we didn’t cover yesterday on Authentic Inclusive Representation and build on the conversation that came up at the end on casting, reverse discrimination, and actions they can take to grow and diversity their talent pools.
 
Our Tech Team is working on the Zoom recording and link; and I’ll put together the key slides in a PDF. If there were any specific slides you all noted that you want to be sure are included please let me know.
 
We look forward to opportunities to work with the local teams, and the fall workshop/
 
I’ll be in touch soon with the link and PDF.
 
All the best,
Tamara

Subject:
 RE: UPI/LCW Workshop #1 Powerpoint
 
Hi LCW Team, 
 
Thank you for your support in planning and facilitating yesterday’s workshop. One down, one to go! Though we didn’t get to all of the planned slides, hopefully what we were able to cover sets a foundation for them as they begin to plan their territory DEI strategies. 
 
When it’s ready, can you please send a link for the temporary recording (with the deadline) and a PDF with the key slides? We’ll be sending this out to the participants along with a brief survey to collect feedback. 
 
We’ll let you know if any of the territories are interested in the localized 1-1 coaching sessions and circle back in a bit to begin finding a date for the Fall Workshop. 
 
Thanks again!
 
Jeff

Subject:
 RE: UPI/LCW Workshop #1 Powerpoint
 
Hi Almendra, 
 
I will look at this closely for any additional notes, but some quick notes:
I've added the logos to the front slide and end slides. I'm not sure if you'd like me to change the first so it looks more like the last, or if the Universal logo is ok on its own. Let me know and I can edit it again if necessary. 
Yes, please make it similar to the last slide so that all logos are sized the same and next to each other. 
I've included the timeline slide at the end so that Paula can go over it in her closing of the workshop. 
Great. 
I'd like to draw attention to the notes in slide 6. I've included mentioning Jean Pascal Zadi's initiative there. I can remove it if we don't get permission. I think it flows nicely, however if by the end of today I don't hear back, then I won't say it. 
Will defer to Paula, but I don’t think we received permission.
I'd like to draw attention to the notes in slide 22. Here is where in the debrief we can mention "must-haves" vs. "nice-to-haves". However, would you like me to bring it up before sending them out into the breakout rooms? As a facilitator I'd like to see them come up with their own ideas and not provide an initial suggestion in case this primes them to think in a particular way. If you are comfortable with that then in the debrief, if they haven't discussed this idea on their own, I can bring it up and we can expand upon it. Is that alright? 
In thinking about it, we want to move away from the term “must-haves” and “nice to haves” with this group. Let’s keep the conversation framed to be focused on being thoughtful and as representative and authentic as possible without giving specific mandates. And yes, I agree that we can see what ideas they come up with first. 
Last but not least, Vince will be opening up the Zoom room and I'll likely be connecting at about 10 minutes before the start time because I'll be getting back then from teaching my class at Stanford University in Madrid. Vince will also have the pdf of the important content slides ready so that we can share them. 
Great, I’ll plan to be in 15 minutes prior. Are we able to record the presentation for those who are unable to attend?
 
Thank you! I’ll go through this in detail this morning and send any additional notes. 
 
Best,
 
Jeff

I'd like to draw attention to the notes in slide 6. I've included mentioning Jean Pascal Zadi's initiative there. I can remove it if we don't get permission. I think it flows nicely, however if by the end of today I don't hear back, then I won't say it.
I'd like to draw attention to the notes in slide 22. Here is where in the debrief we can mention "must-haves" vs. "nice-to-haves". As a facilitator I'd like to see them come up with their own ideas and not provide an initial suggestion in case this primes them to think in a particular way. If you are comfortable with that then in the debrief, if they haven't discussed this idea on their own, I can bring it up and we can expand upon it. Is that alright? 
Last but not least, Vince will be opening up the Zoom room and I'll likely be connecting at about 10 minutes before the start time because I'll be getting back then from teaching my class at Stanford University in Madrid. Vince will also have the pdf of the important content slides ready so that we can share them.
 
All the best,
Almendra

Jeff

Hi Almendra, 
 
I will look at this closely for any additional notes, but some quick notes:
I've added the logos to the front slide and end slides. I'm not sure if you'd like me to change the first so it looks more like the last, or if the Universal logo is ok on its own. Let me know and I can edit it again if necessary. 
Yes, please make it similar to the last slide so that all logos are sized the same and next to each other. 
I've included the timeline slide at the end so that Paula can go over it in her closing of the workshop. 
Great. 
I'd like to draw attention to the notes in slide 6. I've included mentioning Jean Pascal Zadi's initiative there. I can remove it if we don't get permission. I think it flows nicely, however if by the end of today I don't hear back, then I won't say it. 
Will defer to Paula, but I don’t think we received permission.
I'd like to draw attention to the notes in slide 22. Here is where in the debrief we can mention "must-haves" vs. "nice-to-haves". However, would you like me to bring it up before sending them out into the breakout rooms? As a facilitator I'd like to see them come up with their own ideas and not provide an initial suggestion in case this primes them to think in a particular way. If you are comfortable with that then in the debrief, if they haven't discussed this idea on their own, I can bring it up and we can expand upon it. Is that alright? 
In thinking about it, we want to move away from the term “must-haves” and “nice to haves” with this group. Let’s keep the conversation framed to be focused on being thoughtful and as representative and authentic as possible without giving specific mandates. And yes, I agree that we can see what ideas they come up with first. 
Last but not least, Vince will be opening up the Zoom room and I'll likely be connecting at about 10 minutes before the start time because I'll be getting back then from teaching my class at Stanford University in Madrid. Vince will also have the pdf of the important content slides ready so that we can share them. 
Great, I’ll plan to be in 15 minutes prior. Are we able to record the presentation for those who are unable to attend?
 
Thank you! I’ll go through this in detail this morning and send any additional notes. 
 
Best,
 
Jeff

I've included the timeline slide at the end so that Paula can go over it in her closing of the workshop. 
Great. 
I'd like to draw attention to the notes in slide 6. I've included mentioning Jean Pascal Zadi's initiative there. I can remove it if we don't get permission. I think it flows nicely, however if by the end of today I don't hear back, then I won't say it. 
Will defer to Paula, but I don’t think we received permission.
I'd like to draw attention to the notes in slide 22. Here is where in the debrief we can mention "must-haves" vs. "nice-to-haves". However, would you like me to bring it up before sending them out into the breakout rooms? As a facilitator I'd like to see them come up with their own ideas and not provide an initial suggestion in case this primes them to think in a particular way. If you are comfortable with that then in the debrief, if they haven't discussed this idea on their own, I can bring it up and we can expand upon it. Is that alright? 
In thinking about it, we want to move away from the term “must-haves” and “nice to haves” with this group. Let’s keep the conversation framed to be focused on being thoughtful and as representative and authentic as possible without giving specific mandates. And yes, I agree that we can see what ideas they come up with first. 
Last but not least, Vince will be opening up the Zoom room and I'll likely be connecting at about 10 minutes before the start time because I'll be getting back then from teaching my class at Stanford University in Madrid. Vince will also have the pdf of the important content slides ready so that we can share them. 
Great, I’ll plan to be in 15 minutes prior. Are we able to record the presentation for those who are unable to attend?
 
Thank you! I’ll go through this in detail this morning and send any additional notes. 
 
Best,
 
Jeff

subject: RE: UPI/LCW Workshop #1 Powerpoint
body:
Hi LCW Team, 
 
Thank you for your support in planning and facilitating yesterday’s workshop. One down, one to go! Though we didn’t get to all of the planned slides, hopefully what we were able to cover sets a foundation for them as they begin to plan their territory DEI strategies. 
 
When it’s ready, can you please send a link for the temporary recording (with the deadline) and a PDF with the key slides? We’ll be sending this out to the participants along with a brief survey to collect feedback. 
 
We’ll let you know if any of the territories are interested in the localized 1-1 coaching sessions and circle back in a bit to begin finding a date for the Fall Workshop. 
 
Thanks again!
 
Jeff

 Tamara Thorpe <t.thorpe@lcwmail.com>

 Sunday, May 29, 2022 11:36 PM

 Cafuir, Jeff (NBCUniversal) <Jeff.Cafuir@nbcuni.com>; Almendra Staffa-Healey <a.staffahealey@lcwmail.com>; Pratt, Paula (NBCUniversal) <paula.pratt@nbcuni.com>; Vince Bongiovanni <v.bongiovanni@lcwmail.com>

Subject:
 [EXTERNAL] Re: UPI/LCW Workshop #1 Powerpoint
 
Hello Jeff,
 
We are all looking forward to tomorrow's session. I've been able to track communications and stay in touch with Almendra while I've been out of the office. 
 
As I said, I will be there tomorrow morning as well, in the background. With regards to recording, we typically don't record sessions; however, if there are just a few who may miss the session we can make a recording available for a limited time. If it is a more substantial number then it is our recommendation to deliver an additional or make up session.
 
Do you have a sense of how many folks might not be able to attend?
 
And please let me know if there is anything else needed for Tuesday.
 
Tamara

Hi Almendra, 
 
I will look at this closely for any additional notes, but some quick notes:
I've added the logos to the front slide and end slides. I'm not sure if you'd like me to change the first so it looks more like the last, or if the Universal logo is ok on its own. Let me know and I can edit it again if necessary.

I'd like to draw attention to the notes in slide 6. I've included mentioning Jean Pascal Zadi's initiative there. I can remove it if we don't get permission. I think it flows nicely, however if by the end of today I don't hear back, then I won't say it. 
Will defer to Paula, but I don’t think we received permission.
I'd like to draw attention to the notes in slide 22. Here is where in the debrief we can mention "must-haves" vs. "nice-to-haves". Last but not least, Vince will be opening up the Zoom room and I'll likely be connecting at about 10 minutes before the start time because I'll be getting back then from teaching my class at Stanford University in Madrid. Vince will also have the pdf of the important content slides ready so that we can share them.

Jeff

Hi Almendra, 
 
I will look at this closely for any additional notes, but some quick notes:
I've added the logos to the front slide and end slides. I'm not sure if you'd like me to change the first so it looks more like the last, or if the Universal logo is ok on its own. Let me know and I can edit it again if necessary. 
Yes, please make it similar to the last slide so that all logos are sized the same and next to each other. 
I've included the timeline slide at the end so that Paula can go over it in her closing of the workshop. 
Great. 
I'd like to draw attention to the notes in slide 6. I've included mentioning Jean Pascal Zadi's initiative there. I can remove it if we don't get permission. I think it flows nicely, however if by the end of today I don't hear back, then I won't say it. 
Will defer to Paula, but I don’t think we received permission.
I'd like to draw attention to the notes in slide 22. Here is where in the debrief we can mention "must-haves" vs. "nice-to-haves". However, would you like me to bring it up before sending them out into the breakout rooms? As a facilitator I'd like to see them come up with their own ideas and not provide an initial suggestion in case this primes them to think in a particular way. If you are comfortable with that then in the debrief, if they haven't discussed this idea on their own, I can bring it up and we can expand upon it. Is that alright? 
In thinking about it, we want to move away from the term “must-haves” and “nice to haves” with this group. Let’s keep the conversation framed to be focused on being thoughtful and as representative and authentic as possible without giving specific mandates. And yes, I agree that we can see what ideas they come up with first. 
Last but not least, Vince will be opening up the Zoom room and I'll likely be connecting at about 10 minutes before the start time because I'll be getting back then from teaching my class at Stanford University in Madrid. Vince will also have the pdf of the important content slides ready so that we can share them. 
Great, I’ll plan to be in 15 minutes prior. Are we able to record the presentation for those who are unable to attend?
 
Thank you! I’ll go through this in detail this morning and send any additional notes. 
 
Best,
 
Jeff

Subject:
 RE: UPI/LCW Workshop #1 Powerpoint
 
Hi Almendra, 
 
I will look at this closely for any additional notes, but some quick notes:
I've added the logos to the front slide and end slides. I'm not sure if you'd like me to change the first so it looks more like the last, or if the Universal logo is ok on its own. Let me know and I can edit it again if necessary. 
Yes, please make it similar to the last slide so that all logos are sized the same and next to each other. 
I've included the timeline slide at the end so that Paula can go over it in her closing of the workshop. 
Great. 
I'd like to draw attention to the notes in slide 6. I've included mentioning Jean Pascal Zadi's initiative there. I can remove it if we don't get permission. I think it flows nicely, however if by the end of today I don't hear back, then I won't say it. 
Will defer to Paula, but I don’t think we received permission.
I'd like to draw attention to the notes in slide 22. Here is where in the debrief we can mention "must-haves" vs. "nice-to-haves". However, would you like me to bring it up before sending them out into the breakout rooms? As a facilitator I'd like to see them come up with their own ideas and not provide an initial suggestion in case this primes them to think in a particular way. If you are comfortable with that then in the debrief, if they haven't discussed this idea on their own, I can bring it up and we can expand upon it. Is that alright? 
In thinking about it, we want to move away from the term “must-haves” and “nice to haves” with this group. Let’s keep the conversation framed to be focused on being thoughtful and as representative and authentic as possible without giving specific mandates. And yes, I agree that we can see what ideas they come up with first. 
Last but not least, Vince will be opening up the Zoom room and I'll likely be connecting at about 10 minutes before the start time because I'll be getting back then from teaching my class at Stanford University in Madrid. Vince will also have the pdf of the important content slides ready so that we can share them. 
Great, I’ll plan to be in 15 minutes prior. Are we able to record the presentation for those who are unable to attend?
 
Thank you! I’ll go through this in detail this morning and send any additional notes. 
 
Best,
 
Jeff

subject: Re: UPI/LCW Workshop #1 Powerpoint
body:
Hello Jeff,
We are all looking forward to tomorrow's session. I've been able to track communications and stay in touch with Almendra while I've been out of the office. 
As I said, I will be there tomorrow morning as well, in the background. With regards to recording, we typically don't record sessions; however, if there are just a few who may miss the session we can make a recording available for a limited time. If it is a more substantial number then it is our recommendation to deliver an additional or make up session.
Do you have a sense of how many folks might not be able to attend?
And please let me know if there is anything else needed for Tuesday.
Tamara

I've added the logos to the front slide and end slides. I'm not sure if you'd like me to change the first so it looks more like the last, or if the Universal logo is ok on its own. Let me know and I can edit it again if necessary. 
Yes, please make it similar to the last slide so that all logos are sized the same and next to each other. 
I've included the timeline slide at the end so that Paula can go over it in her closing of the workshop. 
Great. 
I'd like to draw attention to the notes in slide 6. I've included mentioning Jean Pascal Zadi's initiative there. I can remove it if we don't get permission. I think it flows nicely, however if by the end of today I don't hear back, then I won't say it. 
Will defer to Paula, but I don’t think we received permission.
I'd like to draw attention to the notes in slide 22. Here is where in the debrief we can mention "must-haves" vs. "nice-to-haves". However, would you like me to bring it up before sending them out into the breakout rooms? As a facilitator I'd like to see them come up with their own ideas and not provide an initial suggestion in case this primes them to think in a particular way. If you are comfortable with that then in the debrief, if they haven't discussed this idea on their own, I can bring it up and we can expand upon it. Is that alright? 
In thinking about it, we want to move away from the term “must-haves” and “nice to haves” with this group. Let’s keep the conversation framed to be focused on being thoughtful and as representative and authentic as possible without giving specific mandates. And yes, I agree that we can see what ideas they come up with first. 
Last but not least, Vince will be opening up the Zoom room and I'll likely be connecting at about 10 minutes before the start time because I'll be getting back then from teaching my class at Stanford University in Madrid. Vince will also have the pdf of the important content slides ready so that we can share them. 
Great, I’ll plan to be in 15 minutes prior. Are we able to record the presentation for those who are unable to attend?
 
Thank you! I’ll go through this in detail this morning and send any additional notes. 
 
Best,
 
Jeff

subject: RE: UPI/LCW Workshop #1 Prep Call (Likely only need 30 mins, but adding extra time just in case)
body:
Hi Almendra, 
 
Attached is the Timeline slide to insert into the end of the PowerPoint presentation. Please send over the updated final slides with notes once you have them. 
 
For the breakouts, if it’s helpful for Tara, Paula and I to be placed in some of the rooms in case we need to help facilitate conversation, feel free to do that. 
 
To recap the agenda:
Welcome
:
UPI: Niels Swinkels, EVP and MD of UPI
GTDI: Janine Jones-Clark, EVP of Inclusion, Talent & Content (Film)
LCW Workshop
Culture and Cultural Competence
Recognize and Challenging Bias
Explore Authentic Inclusive Representation
Planning for Innovation and Inclusion
Next Steps/Timeline slide and Closing
UPI: Paula Pratt, VP of Dubbing, UPI
 
As an FYI, we’re off on Monday for a U.S. holiday, but I’ll be checking emails in case anything pops up. I plan to jump onto the call on Tuesday 15 minutes before it starts.
 
Thanks!
 
Jeff

Subject:
 RE: UPI/LCW Workshop #1 Prep Call (Likely only need 30 mins, but adding extra time just in case)
 
 
Hi Almendra, 
 
It was nice meeting you today, we’re excited for next week. As discussed, attached you’ll find:
Italy’s DEI proposal for reference
Universal Pictures logo (blue) to add to the presentation deck cover and a white version to add to the closing slide. Can you also change the GTDI logo on the closing slide to the white version attached?
I no longer have access to the clip and photo, but here is the context regarding Bad Guys in France:
“Our Star Talent Jean Pascal ZADI who plays the SHARK in Bad Guys hosted a very special private screening for all the kids from his children school. They are all from the suburb of Paris and some of them never had the opportunity to go to a theatre to see a movie. Jean Pascal had a very motivating, authentic and inspiring message for these kids saying that if 
HE
 could do a voice in a major US Hollywood animated movie, then everybody can. I thought it is a perfect example of DEI activation in France…The idea came when I was discussing with Jean-Pascal during the dubbing sessions about his background and the opportunities he encountered along his life. As we met again during the film’s Premiere, we decided to organise a special screening with the children of Pantin to show them his work. Our theatre was packed last Wednesday afternoon with a very enthusiastic audience.”
 
We’ll send over the timeline slide in the coming days, but please let me know if you need anything else. 
 
Best,
 
Jeff

subject: Re: Facilitation Opportunity Confirmation
body:
Hi Vince,
I've only done one group debrief - for Ubisoft and it was only 1 hour. I did it alone, not co-facilitated. So, I don't know what the pay would be for a 2-hour co-facilitated session. I suggest you speak with Tamara and then let me know. I would be more comfortable with this. If you need me to supply a fee, though, do and I will get you a figure.
With regards to this Thursday at 4 pm my time, I'm teaching my Stanford class so I'm not available at that time. If you record the meeting, I could watch it and then meet if I have questions, or I can be briefed separately too.
Thank you,
Almendra
From:
 Vince Bongiovanni <v.bongiovanni@lcwmail.com>
Sent:
 Tuesday, May 24, 2022 21:56
To:
 Almendra Staffa-Healey <a.staffahealey@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: Facilitation Opportunity Confirmation
 
 
Hi Almendra,
 
It was nice seeing you earlier today.
 
That is great news that you are available! One question – did you and Tamara come to an agreement on your fee? If not, could you let me know what your rate would be for this type of training (a 2-hour IDI group debrief cofacilitation)? Once I have that information, I will send over the PA.
 
Also, we are having a meeting to brief all the facilitators doing this session on the content. Are you available this Thursday from 9 – 9:45am cst (I believe that is 16:00 CET)? If not, we can set up some time to go over everything separately. Lmk.
 
Thank you!
 
Vince

Thansk,
Almendra

I'll be arriving home from a teaching a class at Stanford University in Madrid at about 17:50 so I won't be able to connect until then. Since we're going over everything today, I should eb OK to log in ao10-5 minutes before show time.
Thanks,
Almendra

I had it in my calendar as tentative, so it's great to learn that it's been confirmed. I also didn't get PA, so if you can send it through, that would be super helpful since I don't actually have the details for it. If you can fill me in that would be great!
Thansk,
Almendra

Subject:
 NBCUniversal Dubbing Training Content
 
Hello Kelly,
 
I hope you had a great weekend! It was great to get to know you better at last week’s offsite. I was hoping to have a few moments to mention a project that I’m working on, but it didn’t arise. So here we go! 
 
We are working with NBCUniversal’s International Theatrical Dubbing regional teams. I’ve built a custom training for their regional managers that we will be delivering on May 31
st
.  I sent the content over to the client yesterday and I don’t anticipate much feedback; however, if there is any substantive changes that the client would like, I’m hoping that you could take that on since I’ll be out of the office until May 30
th
.
 
One of our external partners, Almendra Staffa-Healy will be facilitating the training, and she is more than capable of making any small amendments or adjustments; however, I wanted to have you as a backup, just in case I totally got it wrong. The deck is here:
 
And Vince is the AC and can give you background on the client and the project. This training is the firs of two, the second will be delivered in the fall. I don’t anticipate needing you, but I’ve told Vince to reach out to you if the client comes back with requests for significant changes to the content.
 
Best case scenario, we won’t need your help. If you have any questions feel free to message me or Vince.
 
Tamara
 
Tamara Thorpe
Senior Consultant
 
LCW 
100 S Saunders Rd, Suite 150
Lake Forest, IL 60045 USA

st
 DEI Workshop scheduled for May 31
st
 from 6:00 to 7:30 pm CET.
 
I am Almendra Staffa-Healey and I'll be the facilitator on the two workshops. I'm based in Madrid, Spain and have been working in the DEI and Intercultural field for the past 20 years. I was born in Spain and have lived and worked mostly between the US and Europe, more specifically with organizations in Spain, France, Switzerland, the UK, Ireland and the Czech Republic. 
 
I'm very much looking forward to working again with NBCUniversal. I will let Vince know my availability so that he might help us set up a meeting.
 
I hope you have a great start to the week,
Almendra

 sábado, 14 de mayo de 2022 20:29

 Cafuir, Jeff (NBCUniversal) <Jeff.Cafuir@nbcuni.com>; Vince Bongiovanni <v.bongiovanni@lcwmail.com>

Asunto:
 RE: GTDI Dubbing Consulting/Training SOW
 
 
Hello Jeff,
 
Thanks for letting us know; if you do need the name switched just let Vince know so he can make the change and get a new copy to you for signature. Or Paula?
 
I have also attached a copy of the DEI Workshop for you to review; it includes the notes. Please let us know if it requires any changes or additions. And if you’d like to set up a time with Almendra, I’ve cc’d her and she can work with you and Vince to find a time to connect.
 
All the best,
Tamara

 Cafuir, Jeff (NBCUniversal) <Jeff.Cafuir@nbcuni.com>

 Friday, May 13, 2022 1:23 PM

>
Subject:
 [EXTERNAL] RE: GTDI Dubbing Consulting/Training SOW
 
Hello Jeff,
 
Great to connect with you today and meet Paula! Now that we have the date and facilitator confirmed, can you please have the SOW/Quote signed and returned to us as soon as possible? 
 
Let me know if you have any questions.
 
Tamara
 
From:
 Tamara Thorpe 
Sent:
 Tuesday, April 19, 2022 8:56 AM
To:
 Cafuir, Jeff (NBCUniversal) <
Jeff.Cafuir@nbcuni.com
>; Vince Bongiovanni <
v.bongiovanni@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Schwartz, Joy (NBCUniversal) <
Joy.Schwartz@nbcuni.com
>
Subject:
 RE: GTDI Dubbing Consulting/Training SOW
 
Hello Jeff,
 
Thank you for your patience; we have a new internal system to draft our SOW’s and currently they are unnecessarily vague. Additionally, there was an error in our SOW that has now been corrected. There will only be a single charge of $7,500 so the correct math is:
 
“Intercultural Competence – undefined; LCW to design a custom facilitated session that emphasize the role of cultural competence in leadership and within their industry” ($7,500 each x 1 = $7,500)
 
To clarify the fees, in the initial proposal that was sent, the fees for facilitated sessions were listed as follows:
 
Because our programs are customizable and flexible, 
these rates represent a baseline of our fees for Standard Programming
. 
1.5 to-3-hour programs (1 facilitator) – starting at $5,500 to $7,500
1.5 to-3-hour programs (2 facilitators) – starting at $8,500 to $12,500
 
Additional Workshop Customizations to adapt content to client’s specific audience (e.g., industry, region, country, or global) or learning objectives are available starting at $3,000
 
Which means there will be a single charge of $3,000 listed as:
 
“Intercultural Competence – undefined; LCW will customize the content for the facilitated session to ensure it meets the specific learning and industry needs of the client.” ($3,000 x 1 = $3,000)
 
Thank you for being so vigilant and once again, we appreciate your patience. Let me know if this resolves your questions. Fingers crossed we got it right this time!!
 
All the best,
Tamara
 
From:
 Cafuir, Jeff (NBCUniversal) <
Jeff.Cafuir@nbcuni.com
> 
Sent:
 Monday, April 18, 2022 1:11 PM
To:
 Vince Bongiovanni <
v.bongiovanni@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Schwartz, Joy (NBCUniversal) <
Joy.Schwartz@nbcuni.com
>; Tamara Thorpe <
t.thorpe@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: GTDI Dubbing Consulting/Training SOW
 
Thanks Vince, 
 
I have a follow up question to the $3,000 charge. Can you clarify the difference between:
 
“Intercultural Competence – undefined; LCW to design a custom facilitated session that emphasize the role of cultural competence in leadership and within their industry” ($7,500 each x 2 = $15,000)
 
and
 
“Intercultural Competence – undefined; LCW will customize the content for the facilitated session to ensure it meets the specific learning and industry needs of the client.” ($3,000 x 1 = $3,000)
 
I thought the $7,500 charge includes a custom facilitated session? There’s another charge?
 
Feel free to call if it’s easier to discuss over the phone. 
 
Best,
 
Jeff
 
 
Jeff Cafuir 
(He/Him/His)
Senior Director, Production Talent & Partnerships | Film
Global Talent Development & Inclusion (GTDI) 
100 Universal City Plaza | Building 2160, Suite 8A
Universal City, CA 91608
 
| (818) 319-6138
  
  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
From:
 Vince Bongiovanni <
v.bongiovanni@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Monday, April 18, 2022 10:46 AM
To:
 Cafuir, Jeff (NBCUniversal) <
Jeff.Cafuir@nbcuni.com
>
Cc:
 Schwartz, Joy (NBCUniversal) <
Joy.Schwartz@nbcuni.com
>; Tamara Thorpe <
t.thorpe@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 [EXTERNAL] RE: GTDI Dubbing Consulting/Training SOW
 
Hi Jeff,
 
Hope you had a great weekend.
 
Thank you for the feedback. Based on it, we have made the necessary adjustments to the SOW, which you can find attached. Please let us know if you have any more questions about it or if you feel anything else needs to be adjusted.
Also, the $3,000 charge for “Intercultural Competence” is the customization fee for building out the training. I hope that helps to clarify things.
 
Looking forward to hearing back about the potential May dates.
 
Best,
 
Vince
 
From:
 Cafuir, Jeff (NBCUniversal) <
Jeff.Cafuir@nbcuni.com
> 
Sent:
 Thursday, April 14, 2022 1:11 PM
To:
 Vince Bongiovanni <
v.bongiovanni@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Schwartz, Joy (NBCUniversal) <
Joy.Schwartz@nbcuni.com
>; Tamara Thorpe <
t.thorpe@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: GTDI Dubbing Consulting/Training SOW
 
Hi Vince, 
 
Thanks for sending this over. A few notes:
Confirming that since we don’t know how many territories will participate, and how many 1-1 sessions are needed, we’re only responsible for the ones we do utilize, and not all 28 as indicated on the SOW ?
With regards to the IDI debriefs:
Can you change the last sentence of the ‘Project Scope & Overview’ section to “IDI assessments and debriefs can be administered as needed to participants at a cost of $450 per debrief session.”
Can you remove the IDI debrief as a deliverable and instead note it’s an “optional”
Can you clarify the $3,000 charge for “Intercultural Competence”? Our approved budget did not include this. 
 
Separately, we’re hoping to hear back from our UPI partners on potential dates in May soon. More to come. 
 
Best,
Jeff

 Vince Bongiovanni <
v.bongiovanni@lcwmail.com
>

Hi Jeff,
 
Hope you are doing well.

Solo usted podrá ver los datos personales y la información basada en los patrones de trabajo de los mensajes de correo electrónico, reuniones, llamadas y chats. Ideas Viva está diseñado para proteger su privacidad. 
 
Obtenga conclusiones que le ayudarán a mejorar
 
Analice la forma en la que trabaja para comprender y mejorar sus patrones de trabajo. 
 
¿No quiere este correo electrónico? 
Cancele la suscripción aquí.

su panel

De:
 IDI Coaching @ LCW <idi@lcwmail.com>
Enviado:
 martes, 12 de abril de 2022 19:51
Para:
 belinda.martinez@ubisoft.com <belinda.martinez@ubisoft.com>
Asunto:
 Your IDI Profile and Plan
 
 
Hello Belinda,
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session tomorrow with Almendra Staffa-Healey. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 10:00am CEST.
 
 
 
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence. 
 
 
 
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of 
your
 debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after 
your
 debrief session. 
 
 
 
In preparation for 
your
 debrief
 
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:  
 
 
 
1.
      
When you took the 
assessment
 you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are? 
 
2.
      
What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures?
 
3.
      
What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?  
 
 
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you!
 
Conner Williams
Associate Consultant
LCW 
100 S Saunders Rd, Suite 150
Lake Forest, IL 60045 USA
Gender pronouns: He/Him/His
